Particle3D is a company that is pioneering a novel method for 3D printing lightweight, customized bone implants that fuse with the skeleton before slowly disappearing. While surgeons have been using bone grafts to treat broken bones, this approach is generally expensive, time-consuming and invasive, as well as only providing temporary repair. Particle3D's bone graft substitutes (known as "Ospreys are manufactured by 3D printing a collagen-based scaffolding material onto an implant that contains cells. These cells are derived from the patient's own bone marrow, and then allowed to differentiate into bone cells. Ospreys have been clinically tested in humans, and have been used to treat a range of bone injuries, including spinal fusion, fractured and non-union bone, as well as tumors and skull defects. One of the great things about Ospreys is that they are biocompatible, and thus do not trigger immune responses. However, 3D printing the implant can be costly and time-consuming. Now, Dr. Darryl Hardcastle and Dr. Alan McGinnis of Particle3D have developed a new technique for printing bone that allows a significantly more rapid production process. In the new study, published in Biomaterials, the researchers describe how they 3D printed a bone scaffold using a "photonic" printer, which utilizes a laser to direct the deposition of particles. The authors found that they were able to rapidly 3D print a scaffold with a relatively low volume of cells, while still maintaining good mechanical properties. The authors note that the new technique could have a number of advantages over other 3D printing methods. For example, it is possible to deposit 3D patterns of different materials to make multi-functional implants. Additionally, the new technique could potentially be used to print implants with customized shapes, which could have a number of applications in personalized medicine. In the study, the researchers used two types of cells for the Osprey implants. The first were mesenchymal stem cells, which are used to repair damaged bone. The second were cells from the patient's own bone marrow, which are used to promote the growth of new bone. The researchers first performed a series of experiments to characterize the scaffolds using the new 3D printing technique. These experiments included testing the mechanical properties of the scaffolds and the biological activity of the cells. The researchers also evaluated how the cells interacted with the scaffolds. The results showed that the new technique produced scaffolds that were biocompatible and that could be loaded with cells, and that the scaffolds maintained good mechanical properties. Importantly, the cells attached to the scaffolds and showed good differentiation into bone cells. Next, the researchers printed Ospreys using mesenchymal stem cells and then transplanted them into a rat model. The Ospreys were then allowed to integrate with the surrounding bone and were observed over the course of 12 weeks. At the end of the experiment, the authors found that the implants were still intact and had formed bone. The researchers note that the study is limited by the use of a rat model, which is not typically used for bone healing studies. However, the authors point out that the results are encouraging and suggest that the new technique could be used to 3D print bone implants in humans. In the future, the researchers plan to explore how the technique could be used to 3D print tissue constructs that could be used for tissue engineering applications. Additionally, they hope to improve the fabrication process, which could be used to print implants with greater complexity.

A study has confirmed that new neurons are still being made well past adolescence, and suggested that older studies that had claimed otherwise were flawed in their methodology. Older studies had relied on certain markers to track the formation of new neurons, but more recent studies have used better methods to track the formation of new neurons in the brain. This has led to greater understanding that neurogenesis, or the process of generating new neurons, occurs in certain regions of the brain throughout life. Some factors that can stimulate neurogenesis include exercise, environmental enrichment, and certain medications. However, the rate of neurogenesis does tend to decline with age, which may be linked to cognitive decline in older individuals.

A study has confirmed that new neurons are still being made well past adolescence, and suggested that older studies that had claimed otherwise were flawed in their methodology. Older studies were based on a technique called carbon dating, which involved detecting the ratio of radioactive carbon-14 to stable carbon-12. The ratio of radioactive carbon-14 to stable carbon-12 can be used to estimate the age of an organism. However, this method is flawed because it only gives an estimate of the age of the cell, not the age of the organism. Researchers at Columbia University's Zuckerman Institute, in conjunction with a team from the University of Basel, decided to re-examine the earlier data using a more recent methodology. The technique used in this study is based on the fact that newer cells will be more likely to divide than older cells. As a result, the telomeres on the ends of the chromosomes will be shorter in newer cells. The new methodology involved detecting telomere length in the hippocampus of both older and younger rats. The researchers found that the telomeres of the neurons in the hippocampus of the younger rats were longer than the telomeres of neurons in the hippocampus of the older rats. This suggests that younger rats have newer hippocampal cells. In the case of the older rats, the researchers found that at least some of their hippocampal neurons were recently created. However, the researchers also found that the older rats had fewer new neurons than the younger rats, suggesting that hippocampal neurogenesis decreases with age. This study suggests that some older adults continue to make new hippocampal cells. In addition, this study suggests that older studies that claimed that adults stop making new neurons were based on a flawed methodology.

A study has confirmed that new neurons are still being made well past adolescence, and suggested that older studies that had claimed otherwise were flawed in their methodology. Older studies had tried to detect the presence of a protein, doublecortin (DCX), in the brain months, or even years after the brain matter was preserved - long after the DCX had deteriorated. The new study examined freshly preserved samples and found a large amount of evidence of newly developed cells. There was about a 30 decrease in the presence of newly developed cells from the youngest to the oldest donor samples, whose ages ranged from 43 to 87. Some scientists remain skeptical of the results, claiming that detected DCX levels were not sufficient evidence for newly developed cells, but the scientists in the study say they used very strict criteria when identifying new cells.

A study has confirmed that new neurons are still being made well past adolescence, and suggested that older studies that had claimed otherwise were flawed in their methodology. Older studies of adult neurogenesis have claimed that the amount of new neurons produced declines with age. However, a recent study, published in the journal Nature, has challenged this claim. The study, conducted by researchers from University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center and Baylor College of Medicine, was based on an analysis of a mouse model, which was fed a low-protein diet. Researchers noted that the mice fed the low-protein diet had lower brain weights, which indicated the animals had fewer neurons. The team further found that the animals also had lower levels of a protein called NGF. NGF is known to be involved in the growth of new neurons. This suggests that the mice were having fewer new neurons in their brains. However, when the team looked at the brains of these mice, they saw that the mice were producing new neurons. In fact, the researchers found that these mice were producing twice as many new neurons as mice that were fed a normal diet. "We have shown that this mouse model, which is deficient in NGF, actually has a lot of new neurons in the brain, and that these new neurons are not dependent on NGF," said the study's senior author Michael Tracey, a professor of neurology at UT Southwestern. The team used different techniques to show that the new neurons in the brain of the mice fed the low-protein diet were neurons. "It's pretty remarkable," said study co-author Rachelle Alessi, a professor of neurobiology at Baylor College of Medicine. The team used different techniques to confirm that the new neurons were in fact neurons. They also used a technique that allowed the team to tag the new neurons. The researchers then found that these new neurons were able to connect with other neurons. "We did a lot of in-depth analysis of these neurons and found that they were forming functional synapses with other neurons," Alessi said. The researchers also showed that the new neurons could mature and function properly. However, the new neurons that were formed in the mice fed the low-protein diet were not the same as the new neurons formed in the normal mice. "These are the same types of neurons, but they are different," Alessi said. "We think that there is a defect in the development of these neurons in the mice fed the low-protein diet." This defect is what made the mice unable to use these new neurons properly. "It's like a kid with a brand new set of Legos. You have all the pieces, but you don't know how to put them together. You're just going to make a mess," Alessi said. The team then used mice that were not fed the low-protein diet. They were able to induce the mice to produce new neurons by using a type of electrical stimulation. This stimulated the mice to make new neurons, but the new neurons were not the same as the ones formed in the mice fed the low-protein diet. "These are very different types of neurons," Alessi said. The study's findings suggest that the type of neurons produced in the brain are different from one person to another. "If you look at a single individual, we know that it's not just the neurons that are being produced in the brain, but it's the type of neurons that are being produced that are different," Alessi said. This means that if one wants to increase the number of new neurons in the brain, one must be careful about which type of neurons are being produced. "We've shown that these new neurons are not all the same," Alessi said. "They are not all the same age, they are not all the same type, and they are not all the same maturity. We have to be careful about what we are looking for." The team is now trying to determine why the mice fed the low-protein diet were able to produce more new neurons than normal mice. "We have some clues, but we don't have all the answers yet," Alessi said.

Older studies had used an antibody that only labelled neurons that were in the process of being born, but the new study used a different antibody that also labelled neurons that had already been born but were still immature. This allowed the researchers to see that new neurons were being made in the hippocampus well into adulthood. The new study also found that the number of new neurons being made in the hippocampus decreased with age, but that the rate of decline was much slower than had been previously thought. This suggests that the hippocampus may continue to play an important role in learning and memory in older adults.

This resulted in him being in hot water with the Chinese government, which was his main reason for stepping down from his role as Alibaba's Chairman. Bloomberg reported that he had spent that time visiting clinics in Hangzhou, where he has been recovering from physical illnesses that caused his absence. In early November, Alibaba had confirmed that Ma was suffering from "tremendous stress" due to the criticism he faced. He had also cancelled a scheduled meeting with Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad in Kuala Lumpur. The former Alibaba Chairman has been very active on the Weibo platform, where he often uploads videos and photos of himself, his family and various Alibaba-related events. After his public appearance in October, Ma posted a photo on Weibo, showing himself in a pink t-shirt, saying that he is recovering well from his illnesses. While Ma is now out of the picture, he remains a valuable asset to Alibaba. He will still be an advisor to the company for the next 12 months, and will continue to be involved in the Alibaba Foundation, which focuses on charity and philanthropic work. Alibaba's current chairman, Daniel Zhang, has recently pledged to invest US10 million in his foundation to aid environmental protection.

This thread discusses projects that were developed but never became profitable. While we hear a lot about successful ventures, there is still a lot to learn from completed, yet unsuccessful, projects. It is important to analyze the reasons why a project failed, in order to avoid these mistakes in the future. Some reasons why a project may fail include: 1. Lack of market need or problem-solving capability: A project may have been developed without fully understanding what the market needs or what problems it really solves. If there is no demand for a particular product or service, then it will ultimately fail. 2. Poor execution: Even if a project has a great idea and is solving a real need, poor execution can be the downfall of the project. This can include issues with project management, lack of resources or funding, or poor decision-making. 3. Technical issues: If a project requires advanced technology that is not yet fully developed or understood, it can be difficult to make it a success. Technical issues can also arise during the development process, causing delays and setbacks. 4. Inadequate marketing or promotion: Even if a project is well-executed and solves a real need, if it is not marketed effectively, it may not reach its target audience. This can lead to poor sales and ultimately, project failure. 5. Competitors and market saturation: If a project is entering a market that is already saturated with competitors, it can be difficult to gain traction and make a profit. Overall, it's important to carefully evaluate the potential market, have a solid project plan, address any technical issues, and promote the project effectively to ensure its success.

This thread discusses projects that were developed but never became profitable. While we hear a lot about successful ventures, there is still a lot to learn from completed, yet unsuccessful, projects. Every entrepreneur goes through a failed project, and this thread is about sharing the stories behind these projects and what was learnt. If you're an entrepreneur and would like to share your story, please answer the following questions. 1) What is the name of your business? 2) What did you sell? 3) How long was the business running? 4) What was the revenue, profit and profit margin? 5) What went wrong? 6) What would you do differently? 7) What did you learn? Example (by Brent from ) I ran a company called PageWise, a publishing company for high school students. We taught them how to publish, edited their books and designed covers, and then printed the books and sold them on Amazon. We sold books, but we weren't profitable. We ran the business for a year. Revenue: 100,000 Profit margin: -12,000 Our biggest problem was the length of the sales cycle. The process for each book took about 6 months (editing, cover design, printing), so we didn't have much cashflow. We were using all of our profits to pay for new books, and that was holding us back. I would focus more on the sales cycle and cashflow. We had a handful of high school students who wanted to publish, but it took so long that many of them gave up on us. We could have had a lot more money if we had made the process a bit faster. I learned that I need to focus on cashflow. With PageWise, we were bringing in money, but we had too many expenses and they were all up front. We needed to make the sales cycle shorter or make the books cheaper, or both. Always a great lesson to learn from. I've had some other ideas that never made it off the ground, but the one that I learnt the most from was a community I ran (back when I was a teenager). I would run an article on the community once every day, and the community would write comments on the article. The whole community revolved around the commenting system. I would then pick the best comment and that person would become the "comment of the day" winner. This community was a great way for me to practice my writing and to learn about website programming (it was built in PHP). It was also the first community that I was ever involved in, which is a great way to learn about how people interact. My community never made money because I never tried to make money from it. It was just a project that I did for fun and to learn from. What I learnt from the community was that people are lazy. Every time I would go away on holidays for more than a day, my community would start to die. People are just lazy, and if you don't have something to give to them every day then they will just ignore you. I have learnt that people need constant stimulation from you, or they will forget about you. The other thing I learnt was that communities take a lot of time to build. It took me years to build my community, and it would take the same amount of time for someone else to build their own community. I still have my community and it's a great source of traffic. I hope other people will post their stories here. I have started an online business and was running for 2 years but due to lack of funds and other business commitments I had to close it. But it was a great learning experience. What did you sell? - I was selling Fan Artwork on my website How long was the business running? - I started the business in 2010 and I closed the business in 2012 What was the revenue, profit and profit margin? - When I started the business, I had a lot of competition and my product was also not unique and was easily available at other stores. So I made a loss of around 500USD in the first year. In the second year I created my own niche product and made a profit of around 650 USD. I had a profit margin of 25 What went wrong? - My product was not unique and I had a lot of competitors. I did not have the funding to advertise and create awareness. Axiom Space has been selected by NASA to build the first commercial habitat module for the International Space Station. The module will be used as a destination for future commercial crews and is designed to demonstrate high-quality spaceflight amenities that can be deployed in large numbers on orbiter missions. The Axiom Space TNG-01 Multi-Purpose Habitat (MPH) was built specifically with NASA's Orion Program needs in mind, such as use of the station liftoff systems and integration into existing launch vehicles. For example, the MPH uses an integrated approach: it includes its own battery bus, which allows a single module or pod to power all basic life support functions; five solar arrays are attached directly to the capsule without splicing wires between them so they do not interfere during deployment from a vehicle; and each capsule holds more than 15 kg of batteries needed for propulsion control. An inflatable thermal protection suit provides crew isolation against radiation while remaining light-weight enough to deploy separately from the rest of the capsule when there is insufficient heat shield material left over after docking operations have completed. In addition, advanced technologies like robotic vacuum cleaners and speech recognition software allow astronauts to operate non-traditional equipment through voice commands rather than complex interfaces controlled by hand gestures or touch screens. (Although this feature still requires manual intervention at times.) An additional benefit to using robotics within an environment is their ability to maintain necessary levels of safety such as ensuring personnel don't get hurt if things unexpectedly go wrong. On average, humans tend to make about 1 million mistakes per year - or one mistake every 24 hours - and robots typically need far fewer training sessions before maintaining safe working conditions. "There isn't much work being done right now because we're trying to develop new technology processes," says Max Chesley, VP GM of Orbital Systems Inc., who forms part of Axiom Space's team responsible for building the TNG-01 capsule. "But once you've developed your process it's very easy to replicate across different modules. Once you begin to scale up you're going to see many benefits." Chesley explains that although he prefers speaking generally about his company, Orbital Systems, outfits both SpaceX, Northrop Grumman, Boeing, Lockheed MartinRockwell Collins and Blue Origin, along with other smaller entities. While these firms may seem to compete with one another on some fronts, the reality is that most often customers actually want multiple solutions offered under a common umbrella, regardless of whether it's delivering food, water, oxygen, air conditioning, heating or anything else even though it's called a packaging concept.

I congratulate Axiom Space on this exciting accomplishment." The International Space Station is a cooperative venture of the United States, Russia, and 15 other countries. Axiom Space has been selected by NASA to build the first commercial habitat module for the International Space Station. The module will be used as a destination for future commercial space flights. NASA announced this morning that Axiom Space has been selected by the agency to build the first commercial habitat module for the International Space Station. Axiom, led by former ISS program manager Mike Suffredini, will fly the module to the station using a SpaceX Dragon cargo spacecraft and attach it to the space station's node 2 forward port. NASA said in its press release that the module will be used as a destination for future commercial space flights. The space station's current configuration can accommodate five people for long-duration missions. Axiom said in a news release that the node would be the first of several modules the company plans to build to expand the station's capacity. Suffredini, Axiom's CEO, said in a statement that the node would be the "world's first commercial space station." He also said Axiom plans to begin manufacturing the node in 2019 and fly the first module in 2022. Suffredini said the station would be a "complement to the ISS," which is scheduled to be retired in 2025. NASA said in its press release that the agency will fund the development of the module. "Axiom will work with NASA to finalize the module's design so it can accept NASA and commercially-developed research payloads," the agency said. The announcement comes as NASA transitions the space station from a government-only facility to a commercially-supported platform. Last month, NASA awarded contracts to SpaceX and Boeing for the development of commercial crew vehicles that will fly astronauts to and from the station beginning in late 2018 or early 2019. The agency also is in the process of developing the Deep Space Gateway, a small space station to be built near the Moon that would serve as a jumping off point for future deep space missions. In addition to Axiom's commercial module, NASA is funding the development of the Bigelow Expandable Activity Module (BEAM), a test module that is scheduled to be launched to the station in April. Mike Suffredini is a real aerospace visionary. When I was working at Marshall Space Flight Center (MSFC) he was the head of the ShuttleISS Program. When he left MSFC, I was told he was going to Houston to work on the new commercial crew program. I was not surprised when he ended up at Axiom.

Fleet is a build tool for Rust. It can compile up to five times faster than cargo. Fleet works by optimizing builds using existing tooling available in the Rust ecosystem. Fleet is available for both Linux and macOS, and it has a variety of features: Runs on Linux and macOS; Contains no Rust code; Compiles up to five times faster than cargo; Enables "hinting" in cargo's documentation to make Rust easier to use; Optimizes cargo's build process; Compiles all crates that use native compilation and do not require explicit compilation in cargo; Enables caching of compilations of many crates; Compiles C and C code with cargo's C toolchain; Generates all needed C header files from Rust crates; Detects dependencies in C code; Builds on Windows; Integrates with Rust's standard tooling; Uses Rust's build system; Requires no Rust code. 2. Crates.io Advertisement Crates.io is a marketplace for Rust libraries and applications. The marketplace is designed to provide easy access to the most popular and well-maintained libraries and applications for the Rust programming language. Crates.io is also a great place to learn how to use the Rust programming language, as it lists many tutorials for Rust beginners. The most popular languages in the Rust ecosystem are C, C, and JavaScript. To see what the Rust ecosystem is currently using, take a look at Crates.io. 3. Glslang Glslang is a tool that converts Rust code to LLVM IR. Glslang is an implementation of the OpenGL Shading Language (GLSL) specification in Rust. It's an important tool for using Rust with the GLSL shader language, which is commonly used to implement graphical effects in computer games. 4. Gobby Advertisement Gobby is a website that makes it easy to share your Rust code with others. Gobby is also a tool that compiles your Rust code to LLVM IR and uses that LLVM IR to generate a web interface for you to use. Gobby was created by my colleague Scott Aylett. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust, because you can share your code with others in a simple web interface. 5. Rust's FFI Advertisement Rust's Foreign Function Interface (FFI) makes it easy to call C and C code from Rust. FFI is a great way to use Rust with C and C code. Rust's FFI is based on LLVM IR, which makes it easy to share Rust code with C and C code. FFI also makes it easy to create C and C bindings for Rust code. The FFI was written by my colleague Charlie King. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 6. Rustc's Target Support Advertisement Rustc's target support lets you compile a Rust program with multiple different versions of the LLVM IR. Rustc's target support was written by my colleague Robert Watson. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 7. Rust's Global Functions Advertisement Rust's Global Functions is a tool that lets you write Rust code that uses global functions. Global functions are functions that are defined in other crates and libraries. They can be called from Rust code, even when the crate or library isn't linked to the Rust program. Global Functions is written by my colleague Simon Marlow. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 8. Rust's Bytecode Advertisement Rust's Bytecode is a tool that lets you compile Rust code to a bytecode file. Bytecode files can be used to run Rust code on different platforms. Rust's Bytecode was written by my colleague Joe Simpson. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 9. Rust's Standard Library Advertisement Rust's Standard Library is a tool that lets you write a new type in Rust. The tool automatically generates a crate that implements that type. Rust's Standard Library was written by my colleague Brian Paulson. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 10. Rust's Types Advertisement Rust's Types is a tool that lets you write Rust code that uses generic types. Rust's Types was written by my colleague Robert Watson. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 11. Rust's Syntax Advertisement Rust's Syntax is a tool that lets you write Rust code that uses the Rust syntax. Rust's Syntax was written by my colleague Peter Lowe. It's a great tool for teaching others how to use Rust. 12. Rust's Macros Advertisement Rust's Macros is a tool that lets you write Rust code that uses macros.

Fleet is a build tool for Rust. It can compile up to five times faster than cargo. Fleet works by optimizing builds using existing tooling available in the Rust ecosystem. Fleet is best for single-target builds, especially on Linux or macOS. It is not well suited to cross-compiling, for instance, building for Windows on Linux. This is a guide to using Fleet for the first time, without getting into details of the configuration. For a more complete guide, see the configuration guide. Note that the option given to target is the build target you would give to rustc. For instance, to build for aarch64 on Ubuntu 18.04, you would use targetarm-linux-androideabi. Fleet has no configuration file. It instead relies on the environment to set options. There is a set of default settings that Fleet will use if you do not provide the information in the environment. These settings are located in the README in this repository. The values of these environment variables are used to populate the configuration file that fleet will use. If you need to set an option that isn't covered by an environment variable, you can set it in your configuration file. Note that you do not need to set any of these environment variables if you are happy with the defaults. Fleet caches builds internally using the cache directory, as well as caching dependencies in Cargo.lock. The default cache directory is .fleet. If you would like to use a custom directory, set the CACHEDIR environment variable. Fleet provides an environment variable, CACHEPACKAGEID, that can be used to make sure the latest version of a package is used. When a package is first downloaded, fleet will calculate a fingerprint of the package. This fingerprint is used to determine if a package has changed. If a package has changed, fleet will rebuild it. If you have a package that you want to make sure is always rebuilt, you can set the CACHEPACKAGEID environment variable to be a random value. This will cause fleet to rebuild the package, no matter what. By default, fleet uses no parallelization. If you would like to enable parallelization, you can set the number of parallel jobs with the CONCURRENCY environment variable. The values of the environment variables listed here are used to populate the configuration file that fleet will use. If you need to set an option that isn't covered by an environment variable, you can set it in your configuration file. Fleet can be used with cargo.toml as well. To use fleet with cargo.toml, simply point fleet at the cargo.toml. On macOS, there is an option to use the clang LTO compiler. This can provide performance improvements and a reduction in build time. To enable this feature, set the CC environment variable to be clang.

The LightSail 2 is part of the Society's mission to prove that small, low-cost spacecraft can travel vast distances by using the sun's energy. The team plans to send the satellite to a higher orbit to see if solar sailing will be able to take the spacecraft beyond Earth's orbit. According to the Planetary Society, the LightSail 2 will be released from the Falcon Heavy into a circular orbit 720 km above the Earth. After a few days, the LightSail 2 will deploy its solar sails. The satellite's four triangular sails will have a total area of 32 square meters. The LightSail 2 will be the first spacecraft to be propelled by solar power. The sails will be made of a special type of material that's only 4.5 microns thick. It is similar to the material used in Mylar balloons. The material will be coated with a reflective substance that will make it more durable and more reflective. The thin material will be pulled taut by the satellite's booms, which will unfurl to 4.5 meters. The booms will be made of a polyamide and fiberglass material that is stronger than steel but only a fraction of its weight. The satellite will be able to move by using solar pressure. Solar pressure is the small push exerted by the sunlight that strikes the sail. The pressure will slowly increase the spacecraft's orbital velocity over time. If the LightSail 2 succeeds, it will be the first spacecraft to be propelled by solar power alone. Virgilio aims to help others navigate through the wide amount of information available on the internet and provide a clear and complete organic learning path for several tools, fields, skills, or concepts. Since the advent of social media, the development of any project, product, service, or organization has been greatly accelerated. Nowadays, if you are not online, you are not really existing. With all these changes and the incredible amounts of data, information, and knowledge being shared online, it is easy to get overwhelmed. In this chapter, we will provide a detailed overview of the information architecture (IA) for your website. The IA is the foundation of the online presence. It provides the structure and structure for the design, navigation, and organization of your website. Without a clear IA, your website will not be as effective as it could be. It will be difficult to navigate and use, and it will not help you attract your target audience. This chapter will explain the fundamentals of IA and provide you with practical examples. The Importance of IA for Your Website In the previous chapter, we talked about the importance of content for your website. However, the content of your website is not the only thing that makes your website successful. Your website's IA plays a very important role in the success of your online presence. When people search for a specific topic online, they do so with a clear intent. For example, when a user searches for online marketing , he or she is trying to find the best and most complete information about this topic. However, if the user's intention is to buy a product, then he or she is trying to find the best product. This is why your website's IA should be well-designed and clearly indicate the information and the links that are most relevant to your target audience. IA plays a very important role in determining the effectiveness of your website. When it comes to IA, there are several factors that you should keep in mind: The ease of navigation: This is the first thing that you need to think about. It is very important that your website's navigation is easy to use. The clarity of information: Your website should clearly indicate the information that your target audience is looking for. It should also clearly indicate the order in which this information is presented. The hierarchy of information: This refers to the order in which the information is presented on your website. For example, it is important that your website's content is organized in a logical and organized manner. The clarity of links: It is important that your website's links are clearly indicated. If your links are not clear, then your website will not be very effective. The Elements of IA We will discuss each of the above factors in this chapter. However, before we get into the details, we need to understand the fundamental elements of IA. The following diagram provides an overview of the elements of IA: The Importance of Keyword Density The importance of keyword density can be understood by looking at the previous diagram. For example, if you want to optimize your website for a specific keyword, you need to make sure that the keyword is present in your content. You can do this by including the keyword in the headings, the main content, the footer, the URLs, and so on. However, it is important to remember that keywords should not be present in the content in a random manner. They should be present in the content in a clear and logical manner. The keyword density should be between 0.5 and 2. If the keyword density is too high, then your website will not be optimized for that specific keyword. However, if the keyword density is too low, then your website will not be effective. The keyword density should be at the right level. The Importance of Keyword Position The keyword position refers to the position of the keyword in the keyword phrase. In other words, the keyword position refers to the position of the keyword in the keyword phrase. The keyword position is very important because it determines the importance of the keyword in the keyword phrase. The keyword position can be either first or last. If the keyword position is first, then it means that the keyword is very important. However, if the keyword position is last, then it means that the keyword is not very important. The Importance of Keyword Density and Position If you want to optimize your website for a specific keyword, then you need to make sure that the keyword is present in your content in a clear and logical manner. In addition, you also need to make sure that the keyword is present in the content in the right position. If you want to optimize your website for a specific keyword, then you need to make sure that the keyword is present in your content in a clear and logical manner.

Virgilio aims to help others navigate through the wide amount of information available on the internet and provide a clear and complete organic learning path for several tools, fields, skills, and certifications. This path is provided via learning and certification paths, which are a clear path of certification exams and related training courses that you can follow to acquire a certification or simply improve your skills and learn more about a certain field or tool. The paths are organized by categories, which are a high-level categorization of the fields and the tools that you can find in Virgilio. There is also a category for all the courses and certifications that do not belong to a specific path. On each category page, you can find a list of all the courses and certifications belonging to that specific category. You can select a category and see all the courses and certifications for that specific category. You can also add to your favorites a category that you want to follow. A course is a training material that will help you learn more about a specific topic. On each course page, you will find the general information about the course, such as the title and the description. You can also see a list of all the certification exams related to the course. You can add a course to your favorites, so that you can later follow it and know when there are news, updates, or simply if you want to learn more about a certain topic in the future. A certification is an official confirmation that you are competent in a certain field or with a specific tool. You can take an exam to demonstrate your knowledge and earn a certification. On each certification exam page, you will find the general information about the certification exam, such as the title and the description. You can also see a list of all the related courses that can help you prepare for the exam. You can also see the list of all the exams that you are going to take and the exam that you already passed. You can add a certification exam to your favorites, so that you can later follow it and know when there are news, updates, or simply if you want to learn more about a certain topic in the future. A learning path is a series of certification exams and related courses that you can follow to acquire a certification or simply improve your skills and learn more about a certain field or tool. You can follow a learning path, so that you can keep track of your progress and know exactly what you have to study and what certification you have to take next. On each learning path page, you will find the general information about the learning path, such as the title and the description. You can also see a list of all the courses and certification exams belonging to that learning path. You can also see the list of all the learning paths that you are going to follow and the ones that you already followed. You can add a learning path to your favorites, so that you can later follow it and know when there are news, updates, or simply if you want to learn more about a certain topic in the future.

Gitmoji allows you to use emojis on git commit messages to provide an easy way to identify the purpose or intention of a commit. A guide on how to use Gitmoji is as follows: 1. Install the Gitmoji CLI by running the following command in your terminal: 'npm i -g gitmoji-cli' 2. Initialize Git emoji in your project by running: 'gitmoji -i' 3. Start using Gitmoji in your commit messages. Instead of writing a traditional commit message like: " ' git commit -m "Added new feature" " ' you can use Gitmoji to make the commit message more expressive and descriptive. For example: " ' git commit -m " Added new feature" " ' The is the Gitmoji for feature addition. 4. Here are some commonly used Gitmoji: - - Initial commit - - Bug fix - - New feature - - Code refactoring - - Removing codefiles - - Performance improvement - - Documentation update - - Deployment Using Gitmoji can help you and your team to quickly understand the purpose or intention of a commit. It also adds a fun and interesting touch to your commit messages!

If you often find yourself googling stuff like "vertical align not working," you might want to keep reading. CSS layouts can be tricky, but mastering them is essential for creating modern, responsive websites. Here are a few tips to help you out: 1. Use Flexbox for simple layouts: Flexbox is a powerful CSS layout system that allows you to create flexible, responsive layouts with just a few lines of code. It's great for simple layouts where you need to align items vertically or horizontally. 2. Use Grid for complex layouts: Grid is another CSS layout system that's great for complex layouts with multiple rows and columns. It allows you to create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes, and is perfect for creating magazine-style designs. 3. Avoid floats: Floats used to be the go-to method for creating layouts, but they can be unpredictable and hard to work with. Flexbox and Grid are much more powerful and reliable, and should be used instead. 4. Try out CSS Grid Garden: If you're new to Grid, try out the fun and educational game CSS Grid Garden. It'll teach you the basics of Grid in a playful and engaging way. 5. Use modals sparingly: Modals are great for displaying information or forms that the user needs to interact with, but they can be overused. Try to use them only when necessary, and consider alternatives like showing and hiding elements instead. By mastering CSS layouts, you'll be able to create beautiful, responsive designs that work across all devices. Good luck!

Congratulations! You've created a modal, and it's working great. But then someone asks you to make the modal's background blue. Now what? Modals typically use multiple positioning techniques, so you'll have to override a few things to change its background color. Step 1: Decide where to put the blue background. I'm going to put it inside the modal element, but you could also put it in the dialog element. Step 2: Set the background color. Now the blue background covers everything inside the modal element. But we want to cover the entire modal, so we're not done. Step 3: Make the dialog element's padding go away. The dialog element has some default padding around its content. That padding doesn't show up when the modal is closed, but it does show up when the modal is open. So, let's get rid of it. Step 4: Make the modal element's height go away. The modal element is absolutely positioned, and it has a height of 100. That's what makes the modal cover the entire screen. But it also makes the modal cover the dialog's padding, which is too much. So, we'll set the height to 0. Step 5: Make the modal element cover the whole screen again. Now that the modal element has no height, it doesn't cover the entire screen. We want the blue background to cover the entire screen, so let's set the modal element's top and bottom values to 0. Step 6: Make the dialog element cover the entire modal. Since we removed the modal element's height, the dialog element doesn't stretch to fill the entire modal. We'll fix that by removing the dialog element's height. Congratulations! You've changed the modal's background color. But what if you want the blue background to cover everything except the dialog's content? This is called a "modal background," and it's pretty easy to make. Step 1: Put the blue background inside the modal element. This time, we're going to put the blue background inside the modal element. Step 2: Put the dialog element inside the blue background. Now the dialog element is inside the blue background, but it doesn't cover the whole blue background. It needs a bit of padding around its content, so it doesn't touch the edges of the blue background. Step 3: Make the dialog element's padding cover the whole blue background. In the previous section, we used the padding property to remove the dialog element's padding, which is the amount of space around its content. But now we want to do the opposite, so let's use the padding property to create some space around the dialog element. Step 4: Make the dialog element cover the entire screen. The dialog element's content covers the entire screen, but its blue background doesn't cover the entire screen. So let's give the dialog element a height of 100. Step 5: Make the modal element cover the whole screen again. Now that we've put the dialog element inside the blue background, we can set the modal element's height to 100 again. If you're trying to make a modal, and you get stuck, try to figure out which elements you're missing. All modals have three elements. The outer element is the element that contains the entire modal. It's usually positioned relative. The container element is the element that contains the content inside the modal. It's usually positioned absolute. The content element is the element that contains the dialog's content. It's usually positioned relative. And if you need help with any of those elements, read this article.

This is a newsletter about CSS layouts (flexboxes, grids, modals, and all that good stuff). If you often find yourself googling stuff like "vertical align not working," you might want to subscribe. I'll send you a digest every month or so with a few of the most interesting articles on the topic, along with a couple of my own. I'll also add in some great CSS libraries and tools, and point you to interesting things in the web design and development world. Why CSS layout? The web is getting bigger and bigger, and we're working with more and more devices and screen sizes. The web is still pretty bad at displaying things on different devices, and we still don't have a good way to make things look good on any device. The web is the biggest, most important thing we've ever done, but it's still not as great as it could be. We still have a lot of work to do. As web developers, we're getting more and more of the responsibility of making sure that things look good on different devices, so it's important that we know what works and what doesn't, and what we need to keep working on. This newsletter will help you keep up with the best and most current CSS layout information, so that you can make sure that things look good on any device. What is CSS layout? In a nutshell, CSS layout is the practice of making things look good on any device. It's a way of telling a browser how to lay things out on different devices. We can use it to make everything from a website to a movie poster to a UI for an app. The way that CSS works is that we use things like grids, flexboxes, and floats to make the browser lay things out the way we want. There's a ton of information out there about how to use CSS layout, and a lot of it is not very good. In this newsletter, I'll be writing about the best information on CSS layout. I'll also point you to the best CSS tools, libraries, and frameworks, and I'll write about the things that I find most interesting in the world of web design and development. I'll also write about CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery, and anything else that I find interesting in the world of web design and development.

Mojo Vision, a startup focused on invisible computing, unveiled a contact lens that has a display that can show information and notifications. Users can interact with the interface by focusing their eyes on different parts of the display. The company did not release a timeline for when the lens will be available for consumers. A new startup unveiled a contact lens that can display information like text messages and directions from Google Maps. Mojo Vision, which is focused on "invisible computing," said it has been developing the contact lens for the past 10 years. The lens has a tiny display that projects information onto the user's field of vision. It's not a screen, however, as the display appears to be projected into thin air. Users can interact with the display by focusing their eyes on different parts of it. For example, a user might look at the top of the display to see the current time or the weather. The lens is powered by a rechargeable battery that sits on the user's finger. It's also outfitted with a microphone and motion sensors. Mojo Vision says the display has a resolution of 14,000 pixels per inch, which the company claims is "better than 2020 vision." The startup said it's working to improve the resolution to 28,000 pixels per inch. Although the lens is meant to be worn every day, Mojo Vision said it's working to reduce the thickness of the contact so that it's less noticeable. The startup said it has partnered with Flex, a company that designs and manufactures wearable products, to create the lens. Mojo Vision also said it has partnered with VSP Global, an insurer and eye-care provider, to make its lens compatible with standard contact-lens fitting and prescription processes. The company did not provide a timeline for when the lens would be available for consumers.

The contact lens is powered by a small chip and battery, and it connects to a smartphone via Bluetooth. Mojo Vision says the lens is comfortable to wear and doesn't interfere with vision. The company is also working on developing a version of the lens that will be able to track eye movements and provide users with additional information. Mojo Vision's contact lens is the latest in a series of wearable devices that aim to make information more accessible. Other companies, such as Google and Samsung, are also working on developing smart glasses and contact lenses that can display information in front of the user's eyes. These devices have the potential to change the way we interact with technology, but it remains to be seen whether they will be adopted by consumers on a large scale.

This repository contains a guide on how to secure anything, whether it is physical or digital. It covers best practices, defenses, vulnerabilities, and more. There are many resources linked throughout this repository. " 'Markdown AWS AWS includes several useful tools to help secure your AWS environment. IAM IAM (Identity and Access Management) is a set of tools that allows you to manage your users, their identities, and their access to AWS resources. The primary tool you will use to secure your AWS environment is the IAM User Policy. IAM Policies can be created to limit user access to AWS resources. " ' Key Management AWS offers several tools for managing your AWS keys. IAM Policy Templates A Policy Template is a collection of one or more IAM Policies. The Policy Template can be created using the IAM console or using the CLI (Command Line Interface). " ' Markdown Amazon CloudWatch Amazon CloudWatch provides a number of monitoring and alerting features. It can be used to monitor AWS resources, AWS events, and AWS infrastructure. " ' Logging Amazon CloudWatch provides a set of logs that can be used to monitor AWS resources. The logs can be used to create alerts. " ' Markdown Amazon CloudTrail Amazon CloudTrail is a service that provides historical data about events and actions that have occurred in your AWS account. " ' IAM Audit Logs IAM Audit Logs can be used to track and review IAM user activities. This allows you to monitor and enforce IAM policy compliance. " ' Markdown Amazon DynamoDB Amazon DynamoDB is a NoSQL database service that provides scalability, availability, and low-latency data access. DynamoDB provides a single consistent view of your data and supports table scans, random writes, and atomic transactions. DynamoDB is designed to scale horizontally to support large amounts of data and is designed to be used in highly-available applications. " ' Key Management DynamoDB provides a set of key management tools. " ' Markdown Amazon Elasticsearch Service Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon Elasticsearch Service, or Elasticsearch for short) is a fully managed, scalable, and elastic search service. Elasticsearch is an open source search engine with an open source Java client library. Elasticsearch provides a web interface that allows you to create, modify, and delete indexes. Elasticsearch provides Lucene indexing and search functionality. Elasticsearch supports the ability to create custom indexes. Custom indexes allow you to create new search functionality, for example, to search a document in a specific format or for specific values. Elasticsearch also provides an HTTP API for performing more complex operations, such as getting the full set of documents in a specific index. Elasticsearch supports the ability to create filters that filter search results by using a specified set of criteria. Elasticsearch provides a number of tools for managing your Elasticsearch cluster. " ' IAM Policies Elasticsearch provides a set of policies that can be used to restrict user access to your Elasticsearch cluster. " ' Markdown Amazon ElastiCache Amazon ElastiCache is a scalable, elastic, and highly available key-value store service. Amazon ElastiCache is a NoSQL database service that provides elastic, fast, and scalable storage for your key-value data. ElastiCache is a replacement for Amazon S3, and provides a consistent API and a scalable, elastic, and highly available data store. " ' Key Management ElastiCache provides a set of key management tools. " ' Markdown Amazon ElastiGroup Amazon ElastiGroup is a group of Elastic Load Balancing instances that provide the capability to scale up or down dynamically, to balance load across multiple servers, and to manage multiple traffic sources. " ' Key Management ElastiGroup provides a set of key management tools. " ' Markdown Amazon ElastiPage Amazon ElastiPage is a scalable, elastic, and highly available key-value store service. Amazon ElastiPage is a replacement for Amazon S3, and provides a consistent API and a scalable, elastic, and highly available data store. " ' Key Management ElastiPage provides a set of key management tools. " ' Markdown Amazon ElastiPut Amazon ElastiPut is a scalable, elastic, and highly available key-value store service. Amazon ElastiPut is a replacement for Amazon S3, and provides a consistent API and a scalable, elastic, and highly available data store. " ' Key Management ElastiPut provides a set of key management tools. " ' Markdown Amazon ElastiWeb Amazon ElastiWeb is a scalable, elastic, and highly available key-value store service. Amazon ElastiWeb is a replacement for Amazon S3, and provides a consistent API and a scalable, elastic, and highly available data store. " ' Key Management ElastiWeb provides a set of key management tools.

I recently watched an episode of Dorkbot where they go into great detail about securing your container images with Docker Compose security rules; check out their video here Just as you would want passwords in your files and databases secured, keys should be protected especially if you have multi-tenant applications integrated within one application server (i.e., GCP App Engine). You could encrypt your key file using PBKDF2, but I prefer storing the encrypted version locally until I'm ready to deploy it outside my control:

So the Robinhood checking and savings account that was in Friday's TLDR that offered 3 interest turned out to be a bit too good to be true. The accounts claimed that they were covered by the SIPC (Securities Investor Protection Corp) but they aren't. The SIPC statement below is an explanation as to why they aren't covered. "SIPC is not responsible for the loss of funds that are not part of a Member's segregated account." "SIPC protects cash that is deposited with a brokerage firm for one limited purpose and that is the purpose of purchasing securities. SIPC does not protect checking and savings accounts since the money has not been given to the broker to purchase securities. SIPC does not insure investments in stocks, bonds, mutual funds or other investments or investment contracts, including shares in Money Market Mutual Funds. While a Money Market Mutual Fund may seek to preserve the value of your investment at 1.00 per share, it is not guaranteed by SIPC." So while this is definitely good to know, I still think its good to have some of your money in one of these types of accounts if you want to keep some money liquid while still getting interest.

The International Space Station is supposed to retire in 2024, though that date will probably be pushed back to 2030. It is slowly leaking air and getting increasingly expensive to fly. So the Russian space agency Roscosmos wants to do a big job of upgrading it before it's too late: This week we were able to carry out preparations for launching of our spacecraft into orbit around Earth from the Japanese Pacific island Hokkaido [...] The launch technology for this mission was developed by engineers at JAXA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, which has been working on similar systems since 1997 (via NASASpaceflight) In one sense they are right - the ISS costs more than ever to maintain as its ongoing operations have become so complicated. And now NASA has backed down on plans to upgrade the station after several months of argument between Congress and their administration over budget cuts.

The International Space Station is supposed to retire in 2024, though that date will probably be pushed back to 2030. It is slowly leaking air and getting increasingly expensive to maintain. A commercial space station is a real possibility, and NASA is open to it, but it is not a given. NASA's initial estimates were that the International Space Station would cost 8 billion to build and maintain. That number ended up being off by a factor of four. It cost 35 billion to get the ISS into orbit. That is about 60 billion in today's money. In comparison, the Hubble Space Telescope, an amazing piece of space technology, cost 1.5 billion in 1990, or about 2.9 billion in today's dollars. The International Space Station is one of the greatest human achievements. It is a testament to our engineering and technological prowess. But like any home it needs maintenance and upkeep. Even with the best maintenance, things break and need to be fixed. Space walks are the most expensive type of repairs. It takes astronauts about 300 hours to prepare for a space walk. Two astronauts spent 22 hours installing a replacement coolant pump on the ISS in 2010. This repair cost an estimated 110 million. One of the major costs of maintaining the ISS is sending things up in rockets. A rocket launch costs around 200 million. These rockets need to be sent up periodically to supply the station with food, water, and other necessities. The International Space Station will need to be de-orbited and destroyed when it is no longer useful. Currently, the ISS orbits 240 miles above the Earth's surface. De-orbiting it will be an expensive task that will take a lot of time and resources. The International Space Station is a modern marvel. It has been in operation since 1998 and has been visited by over 200 astronauts from 15 different countries. It has been used as a space observatory, a space laboratory, and a space hotel. It has allowed us to perform experiments in microgravity and observe our home from a vantage point that was previously unimaginable. But the International Space Station is an old space station. And like all old homes, it requires a lot of maintenance. It is expensive to keep up. The United States alone spends about 3 to 4 billion per year on the International Space Station. That is a lot of money for a country with over 21 trillion in debt. In this article, we will explore some of the costs of maintaining the International Space Station. We will also explore whether it is worth continuing to use the space station or whether it is time to de-orbit it and replace it with a new space station. The International Space Station was first imagined in 1984. It was the result of a collaboration between the United States, the Soviet Union, Japan, and the European Space Agency. The space station would be an international scientific laboratory. It would allow astronauts from different countries to live and work together in space. In the beginning, the International Space Station was envisioned as a much smaller space station. It was supposed to cost 8 billion to build and maintain over 10 years. The projected cost of the space station ballooned to 35 billion by 1993, the year the first component was launched. The United States agreed to pay for 25 billion of the cost. This was a pretty penny considering the United States had a budget deficit of about 300 billion that year. The International Space Station had a rough beginning. The Space Shuttle Challenger disaster of 1986, the fall of the Soviet Union in 1991, and the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster of 2003 all threatened to derail the project. But the United States, Russia, Japan, Canada, and 11 members of the European Space Agency remained committed to the space station. The International Space Station was constructed piece by piece over the course of a decade. It was launched in parts and assembled in space. Each component was launched into space by a Space Shuttle or a Russian Proton rocket. The first component was the Russian Zarya module. It was launched in November 1998. It was followed in December 1998 by the American Unity module. Over the next decade, more components were added to the International Space Station. A good friend of mine recently started an ecommerce business called Drunk Shrub, it sells shrub, a tangy syrup that you can mix with alcoholic beverages or carbonated water to create flavorful drinks. Social media marketing: Your friend can use social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter to promote her business. She can share eye-catching images of her product, share customer reviews, create fun contests and giveaways, and interact with potential customers. 2. Collaborate with influencers: Your friend can collaborate with influencers in the food and beverage industry. This can help reach a wider audience and potentially attract more customers to her business. 3. Attend food and beverage events: Your friend can attend food and beverage events such as food fairs, trade shows, and tastings. This will allow her to network with other businesses and showcase her product to potential customers. 4. Offer discounts and promotions: When starting a new business, it can be difficult to attract customers. Offering discounts and promotions can help incentivize people to try out her product and become a repeat customer. 5. Create a referral program: A referral program is a great way to incentivize satisfied customers to refer their friends and family to her business. This can help her reach a wider audience and increase her customer base over time.

I've discovered over time though that it's not always necessary to have strong branding behind your product name if you're just getting into e-commerce - especially since most customers aren't aware of who you really are yet so why bother giving yourself any extra work? In fact, even though I know myself personally through social media platforms like Instagram, Twitter and Facebook I'm sure none of us has mentioned our full real identity online much less created a fake persona out of it. The reason being we don't want things to get too personal and embarrassing which might lead to negative feedback from other members within their circles. So instead I recommend starting small and having fun while still exploring where this journey takes you! Aside from trying different brands and scouting potential suppliers you need to start defining your target audience by identifying demographics, interests concerning lifestyle preferences on buying habits etc. This way you wouldn't waste resources marketing wrongly and thus eventually become part of the problem rather than solving it. Once that's done you'll then have a clearer idea on how best to approach your prospective clients and build rapport using appropriate channels. For example if you're targeting younger folks to promote self-expression, you'd better choose a channel shortlisted specifically for youth and include visuals in posts showing off happy moments. Another thing worth pointing out here is that each client should receive individual attention based upon hisher preference regardless of whether he's new to the communitybrand or longtime fans. You may think "sure!" but those messages can easily go unnoticed if others keep posting updates without taking notice of responses and views left. Therefore focus on building genuine connections with fellow shoppers first before moving forward with sending direct offers. If you sell unique items such as organic teas, homemade soft serve ice creams, vintage clothing or knick-knacks, remember to capture interest among local or regional communities. Trying something special doesn't necessarily mean creating content; providing discounts or free shipping for orders above certain amount could do wonders. It's never right to forget affordability either although appealing prices usually creates demand. Just ensure all costs involved remain reasonable allowing everyone to pay according to themselves' existing budget. One particular tactic I've found quite useful involves sharing interesting facts regarding popular culture, pop-culture trends and telling stories related to your industry along with relevant imagery. In my case for instance I often post photos illustrating the story of my life embedded inside the context of agriculture alongside references to food safety regulations and healthy eating habits. I'm currently working on another project involving farming animals for human consumption and I'd love for you to check it out soon at By nowyou probably understand why naming your brand (s) shouldn't simply happen randomly. If nothing else it will help establish credibility and give away many aspects of the company including its core values, expertise, strengths, weaknesses and future plans. However, if you're unable to find anything suitable consider incorporating elements such as natural ingredients, animal welfare practices, vegan-friendly meals andor environmentally friendly activities amongst other concepts according to your niche market. The point of acronym is that they're easier to remember compared to longer words - no matter if they link back to your original intentions or not. However, this technique won't instantly attract thousands of followers unless you create some genuinely impressive contents to support your claims. Keep writing quality articles, share photosvideos featuring various angles highlighting beauty, style tips and home decoration ideas. You'd better avoid talking purely about yourself and instead highlight positive points made by your competitors plus try putting together reviews written by satisfied consumers. Remember that success hinges largely on finding balance between authenticity vs. exaggeration; instructional info vs. sales promotions. However, try aiming for high standards both internally and externally throughout your entire blogging process. Becoming famous requires maturation through consistent efforts and doing great job outside means improving everything around you inside. It's hard enough for competitor sites to catch up due to lack of advertising money now let alone if you're going low-key. So choose carefully. Whether you use images to illustrate your text or vice versa - adding captivating background designs to your blog pages definitely makes readers experience your website as enticing as possible. Don't hesitate to invest some effort establishing a user-friendly interface combining sophisticated design techniques and modern tech tools enabling viewers to navigate freely across features offered. Although keeping up with current technological advancements seems exciting initially, setting priorities saves valuable time helping to bridge gaps in communication between staff members and external partners alike. Sharing news with customers via email regularly allows you to stay connected in addition to nudging them towards engaging more with each other on social

A good friend of mine recently started an ecommerce business called Drunk Shrub, it sells shrub, a tangy syrup that you can mix with alcoholic beverages or carbonated water to create some pretty sweet cocktails. A great friend of mine, AJ (you may remember him from this post) did a little bit of research on the market and started selling a bit of shrub online to see if he could make a little money. The good news is, the business has already started to take off, but the bad news is that he didn't do much research. When I asked him what he thought about my site, he said that it looked really good and that he really liked the content and I had a lot of good ideas. It took me a second to realize that he was saying that he really liked my site because I was a good friend of his. I'm not sure how many of you are reading this post, but if you are, please do yourself a favor and check out my site. It's pretty simple and straightforward, but there are a lot of good content pieces that I think you will like. My main goal with my site is to help people who are in a similar situation as I was when I started my business, so I have created a page called "Starting Your Own Business."

Iberospinus natarioi, a newly identified 8-meter-long predatory dinosaur, represents a new genus and species of spinosaurid, a group that includes the Spinosaurus. An analysis of the spinosaurid's jaws found that it belonged to the most complete dinosaur skull yet found in Europe. The skull, which was discovered in Portugal in 1999, is being presented in the journal Cretaceous Research. The fossil was embedded in the rock of the Guimarota mine, a large-scale open pit coal mine. Since its discovery, the fossil has been studied and prepared by researchers in Portugal and Spain. Spinosaurids were a group of large carnivorous dinosaurs that first appeared about 170 million years ago and were extinct by about 90 million years ago. They had distinctive skulls, with long snouts and sharp teeth, and were adapted to eat fish and other aquatic animals. The group includes some of the longest predatory dinosaurs known to science. Spinosaurid fossils have been found in Europe, North Africa and South America. Iberospinus is the second spinosaurid found in Europe, and the second in Portugal. It is the first known dinosaur from the Late Jurassic of Iberia, a region of the Iberian Peninsula. It lived about 150 million years ago. The fossil is the most complete dinosaur skull found in Europe and has a number of unique characteristics. One of the most striking is the presence of a long spike-like snout. The snout is long and narrow, with a long skull that is similar to the skull of other spinosaurids. The researchers identified three key features that led to the classification of the fossil as a new species. It has three skull openings - a large one in the middle of the skull and two others near the tip of the snout. The fossil also shows that the skull was covered with a thick layer of bone. The features are distinct from other spinosaurids. The researchers also discovered that the new species has a number of unique features in the skull bones that are found in other spinosaurids. These features may have helped the spinosaurid to catch and consume its prey. The fossil, which was found in the Late Jurassic strata, suggests that this dinosaur lived alongside a diverse group of dinosaurs, including the giant herbivorous dinosaurs called diplodocids. The fossil was discovered in the Guimarota mine, a large-scale open pit coal mine. The mine, which is located in the Leiria District in central Portugal, is an area rich in dinosaur fossils. In 2001, researchers reported that they had discovered an 8-inch (20-centimeter) claw from a theropod dinosaur in the Guimarota mine. The theropod, which was later named Baryonyx galae, lived about 130 million years ago. It was the first dinosaur discovered in the mine. A second dinosaur, Alocodon kuehnei, was discovered in 2002. It also lived about 130 million years ago. In 2012, researchers announced the discovery of two new species of dinosaurs in the mine. They included an unusual plant-eating dinosaur and a theropod dinosaur. The new fossils were described in the scientific journal PLOS ONE. Both fossils are from the Jurassic period, which lasted from 200 million to 145 million years ago. The plant-eating dinosaur was a member of a group known as diplodocoids, which includes sauropods like Diplodocus and Brontosaurus. The theropod was a member of the Allosaurus family.

An analysis of the spinosaurid's jaws found that it grew teeth to replace those that broke or got lodged in prey. Replacement teeth aren't uncommon in spinosaurids, but this species' system allowed for a much faster turnaround time. Its teeth were also serrated. The dinosaur had a complex system of nerves in its lower jaw that probably helped it sense prey more effectively.

Iberospinus natarioi, a newly identified 8-meter-long predatory dinosaur, represents a new genus and species of spinosaurid, a group that includes the Spinosaurus. An analysis of the spinosaurid's jaws found that they were well-suited for catching and eating fish, indicating that it likely spent a lot of time in or near bodies of water. The Iberospinus natarioi is believed to have lived during the Late Cretaceous period, around 95 million years ago, in what is now Portugal. Its discovery provides new insights into the diversity and evolution of the spinosaurid group and adds to our understanding of the ecosystems that existed during the Late Cretaceous period.

Prioritize vulnerabilities: Once you identify vulnerabilities, prioritize them based on severity and the potential impact they may have on your organization. 3. Develop a plan of action: Based on your priority list, develop a plan of action to remediate vulnerabilities. Automate where possible: Automating vulnerability remediation can help to speed up the process and scale the remediation capabilities. 5.
